channel.title: Your Future
channel.description:
I was just curious as to what you all, the members of the MoparScape community, plan on doing in the future. What is your 'dream job?' Right out of high-school I want to move down to [i]Eddyville[/i], [i]KY[/i] and become a correctional officer working for the state penitentiary.
Why? Well, for about 2-3 years now I have had my mind set. I was debating whether or not to become a police officer or a CO, I went with CO. I've always had a fascination with prisons/inmates. No, I have no clue why.
So, what do you all plan on doing?

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Fails, post:41, topic:465231”]To the rest of you, it seems as if you all have everything planned out, which is great! I know a few people that are seniors in high-school and have not a single clue about what they’re going to do after graduation, which obviously isn’t good.[/quote]I had no clue what I wanted to do when I was a senior too, and even after I registered for state college and was taking classes. Most people are undecided, but that’s not bad; it’s better to pick something you love, taking time and researching, instead of picking some bogus major just for the money and doing something you hate for the rest of your life.

Read full topic

@Casey, I want to be a ‘regular’ c/o as it’s something I have been wanting to do for quite sometime now.

To the rest of you, it seems as if you all have everything planned out, which is great! I know a few people that are seniors in high-school and have not a single clue about what they’re going to do after graduation, which obviously isn’t good.

@Omer, yes, how are you so sure you’re going to die soon?

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I want to do something with computer science, but there is always a part I come across that makes me lose inspiration and faith in my future. There are many times where I just stop caring and give up all hope for my future, which is why I went from an honor role student to getting high B averages on assignments. I’m taking my third year in an engineering class (includes several branchs; electrical, mechanical, and industrial), but the knowledge we learn is sometimes limited and simple. I’m trying to bring my grades up and get involved in more extracurricular activities, because those play a huge factor in being accepted to a certain college.

Read full topic

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I’m going to college in July and will graduate in 3 years with a BS degree in game programming and simulation. I’ll be making games professionally, and probably going musical stuff on the side (or full time) because my band is actually good enough to get ‘signed’.

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:32, topic:465231”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=570113.msg4133106#msg4133106 date=1351372856]

I will try completing my educating and try to not kill myself.

There is no try there is only do

I lack motivation in both my life and education. Therefore the word “try”.
[/quote]that is still wrong though.

“trying” means you have the motivation and are attempting just failing.

Lacking in something means not having a required piece to achieve whatever it is. That’s like saying " I lack the motivation to eat more" for a bulimic. Just doesn’t make sense. Where as it could be " I am trying to eat more, but can’t thus I am puking it all up! "

[/quote]It’s more ludicrous you would use the character from Hogan Heroes, Kernel Klink in that picture as he is an idiot so I really wouldn’t call him a grammar nazi.

Read full topic

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Bowser jr:

I will try completing my educating and try to not kill myself.

There is no try there is only do

OT: I’ve recently been debating between computer science and game programming, and then engineering. I actually enjoy game programming. Been taking a swing at it lately and its fun, but I have training in engineering and robotics as well. I have a strong chance at getting a job at a software company within the next couple of weeks so we will see how that goes.

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Yeah, it is really good to have something to fall back on when shit goes bad.

[quote=“RandQm, post:15, topic:465231”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=570113.msg4132493#msg4132493 date=1351286828]
I plan on earning my masters in mechanical engineering by starting out in Palm Beach State College to earn my associates degree, then transfer to a University in Florida which offers a great engineering program. I want to work on robotics for a living, creating the next big thing in technology; a full-functional autonomous robot that will soon be in everybody’s home.
[/quote]
not in my home[/quote]Actually, there already is an somewhat autonomous robot in everybody’s home. Not one that can mimic human behavior, but one that can do simple tasks like using the internet, making calls, GPS, etc.; a smartphone if you don’t catch my drift.

Read full topic

item.title: Your Future
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

-inventor-gl, 1/5 of all inventions fail(business week)
-beta tester-can/is/will be done for free
-pro gamer (srs, you CAN be paid for this)-gl, I played competitive and in the end there is always someone better, a new game comes out, etc. Also, gl with the koreans.
-pornstar-gl actually being someone and making a living
-buy/sell domains-…
-drug dealing ( not legal obviously but it’s done )-gl doing this for more than a few years

just saying, ya know. Most people want stability in their future.

Frell:

says casey who makes money flipping rs gold

Sadly I retired from flipping gp. Now I pay asians to work my site for me, go to the bank every few days in my BMW from my beach condo, stop at a five star for some lunch than come back. My partner has a degree in business and I’m going to get a minor in business so don’t pull this no degree crap either.

Read full topic
